Package sealey.javafxinventorysystem.utility

Class Helpers

java.lang.Object
sealey.javafxinventorysystem.utility.Helpers
public class Helpers extends Object
The Helpers class contains a variety of methods used in the controller classes.
Author:
Max Sealey

  • Constructor Details

    • Helpers

      public Helpers()

  • Method Details

    • search

      private static boolean search(int id)
      Helper function that returns a boolean indicating whether an integer is already being used as an ID number This is only called in the generateID() method to ensure that the auto-generated ID is unique.
      Parameters:
      id - Integer to be checked for ID uniqueness
      Returns:
      boolean True if ID belongs to existing part, False otherwise

    • generateID

      public static int generateID(boolean partOrProduct)
      The generateID() method is a helper function that generates an ID number for created part. Always returns the next positive available ID
      Returns:
      id Unique part ID

    • isInt

      public static boolean isInt(String str)
      The isInt() method checks whether a provided string can be converted to an integer and returns a boolean.
      Parameters:
      str - The string to be checked
      Returns:
      boolean Returns true if string is also an integer, false if exception is caught

    • checkStockValues

      public static boolean checkStockValues(int min, int max, int stock)
      User input validation for Inventory level, max, and min values
      Parameters:
      min - minimum inventory level
      max - maximum inventory level
      stock - current inventory level
      Returns:
      boolean True if min is positive and less than stock, and stock is less than max

    • setPartTables

      public static void setPartTables(javafx.collections.ObservableList<Part> parts, javafx.scene.control.TableView<Part> table, javafx.scene.control.TableColumn<Part,Integer> idCol, javafx.scene.control.TableColumn<Part,String> nameCol, javafx.scene.control.TableColumn<Part,Integer> stockCol, javafx.scene.control.TableColumn<Part,Double> priceCol)
      Populates table with data from each of the parts that are passed in. Table1 should always contain a list of the parts in inventory, Table 2 a list of parts associated with the product.
      Parameters:
      parts - List of parts to be represented in each row
      table - Table
      idCol - ID column
      nameCol - Name column
      stockCol - Stock column
      priceCol - Price column

    • setProductTable

      public static void setProductTable(javafx.collections.ObservableList<Product> products, javafx.scene.control.TableView<Product> table, javafx.scene.control.TableColumn<Product,Integer> idCol, javafx.scene.control.TableColumn<Product,String> nameCol, javafx.scene.control.TableColumn<Product,Integer> stockCol, javafx.scene.control.TableColumn<Product,Double> priceCol)
      Populates Product table in Main Window with data from each of the parts that are passed in
      Parameters:
      products - List of parts to be represented in each row
      table - Table
      idCol - ID column
      nameCol - Name column
      stockCol - Stock column
      priceCol - Price column

    • setProduct

      public static void setProduct(Product updatedProduct, int id, String name, int stock, double price, int min, int max)
      Sets data to a product
      Parameters:
      updatedProduct - List of parts to be represented in each row
      id - id
      name - name
      stock - stock
      price - price
      min - min
      max - max

    • setProduct

      public static void setProduct(Product updatedProduct, Product oldProduct)
      Sets data to a product from another product
      Parameters:
      updatedProduct - product that receives data
      oldProduct - product that provides data

    • filterProducts

      public static javafx.collections.ObservableList<Product> filterProducts(String search)
      The filterProducts() method checks a string and returns a list of Products whose name contains the string, and/or whose ID is equal to the string.
      Returns:
      ObservableList of Products containing all products whose name contains the search parameter and/or whose id is equal to the search parameter, or list of all Products.

    • filterParts

      public static javafx.collections.ObservableList<Part> filterParts(String search)
      The filterParts() method checks a string and returns a list of Parts whose name contains the string, and/or whose ID is equal to the string.
      Returns:
      ObservableList of Parts containing all parts whose name contains the search parameter and/or whose id is equal to the search parameter, or list of all Parts.
